description: Anchovies and black olives will tickle your tongue and awake your senses.

name: Fondant au Chocolat
description:
One of the quickest and easiest recipies, but the secret is to know when to stop cooking it.
(tip to remember the recipe: quantities are multiples of 50)

steps: Melt the chocolate and the butter together.
Mix the eggs and the sugar together, and add the melted chocolate and butter.

name: Quiche au Cantal
description:
This quiche is made with Cantal, a cheese from Auvergne (the region I'm from in France).
We use Cantal Jeune ("Young Cantal") which has a not too strong taste.
And this is my mom's recipe! So you know it's got to be good.

steps: Mix the double cream, the milk and the eggs together.
Lay the pasty over a big enough tart tin.
Spread the cubes evenly over the pastry.
Cook until the egg mixture is cooked (doesn't stick to a knife) for ~30mins @ 200°C.

description: Egyptian recipe of my mother-in-law, you know this one will be good.

name: Salade Composée
description: Get some good healthy (or not) ingredients and put them all together to make a tasty mixed salad. I like mine colorful.

ingredients: Any sauce you like (I recommend vinaigrette)

name: Petits Cochons
description: Marzipan covered pastry cream & sponge cake sandwich. Traditionally shaped like small pigs, but make your own shapes, it's fun to have people guess.

name: Kunafa
description: Another Egyptian recipe from my mother-in-law, whether you have a sweet tooth or not, you're in for a treat.

name: Ratatouille Canelle-Cumin
description: The traditional Ratatouille with a good amount of spices.

name: Crumpets Eggs Royale
description: I put this one here because I LOVE runny egg yolks with salmon and a squeeze of lemon. I discovered this in the UK. Don't get me wrong, I usually follow the stereotype and complain about food in the UK, but I have to give this one to the British.

steps: Boil (or break and microwave in a mug each of) the eggs for ~5mins.
Toast or heat up the crumpets, then put a slice of smoked salmon, lemon juice, and a peeled egg on top.
